segments.text: Looking into this kitchen, everything seems so ordinary at first.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's apron and dress make her look like a classic homemaker.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But that faucet is pouring water everywhere, and she's oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is spreading, and it could ruin the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Those kids are up to no good, sneaking cookies behind her back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so high on that shaky stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: If he falls, it could be really bad with all that water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just egging him on, hand out like she's entitled.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes are stacked neatly by the sink, waiting to be put away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open cabinet shows the cookie jar full and tempting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside the window, the garden is calm, totally unaware of the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's sad how these little accidents are about to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to say something before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
